column4: Hi I was wondering if someone could please help me diagnose my sound issues on Breezy?
then ALSA wasn't loaded properly. What's the output from: lspci -v|grep -i audio
0000:00:07.5 Multimedia audio controller: VIA Technologies, Inc. VT82C686 AC97 Audio Controller (rev 50)
scroll up, already said dmesg reports it's fine
#2: VIA 82C686A/B rev50 with ICE1232 at 0xa000, irq 9
that has nothing to do with the command I just gave you.
ah my bad. i'm not using modules, so that command doens't apply.
using your own kernel? How can we possibly support manual configurations? There are a plethora of possible screwups.
i'm not asking for the ubuntu team to support it, i came here looking for community support/advice
if you don't the standard kernel, it's difficult to know where things could have gone wrong.
it worked fine w/ the same kernel under hoary
the same kernel? And which one is that?
i built it from vanilla sources
so post your .config somewhere. You really need to help the troubleshooting process...
